generif.text: Fibulin-1 has pronounced inhibitory effects on cell attachment and spreading promoted by fibronectin (FN) and suppresses the motility of a variety of cell types on FN substrates.

interpro.desc: Growth factor receptor cysteine-rich domain superfamily

name: fibulin 1
summary: Fibulin 1 is a secreted glycoprotein that becomes incorporated into a fibrillar extracellular matrix. Calcium-binding is apparently required to mediate its binding to laminin and nidogen. It mediates platelet adhesion via binding fibrinogen. Four splice variants which differ in the 3' end have been identified. Each variant encodes a different isoform, but no functional distinctions have been identified among the four variants. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
